Package oh_hecc.game_parts

Class GameDataObject

java.lang.Object
oh_hecc.game_parts.GameDataObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
EditWindowGameDataInterface, Heccable
public class GameDataObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Heccable, EditWindowGameDataInterface
A single class that can encapsulate all the game data stuff

    • GameDataObject

      public GameDataObject​(java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> pMap, MetadataEditingInterface meta, java.nio.file.Path saveLocation)
      Instantiates a new Game data object.
      Parameters:
      pMap - the passage map
      meta - the metadataeditinginterface object
      saveLocation - where the hecc file is saved

    • GameDataObject

      public GameDataObject​(MetadataEditingInterface meta, java.nio.file.Path saveLocation)
      Constructor used for creating a completely new gamedataobject (when making a new .hecc file)
      Parameters:
      meta - the MetadataEditingInterface containing metadata for the new game
      saveLocation - the save file location for this new game

  • Method Details

    • updateLinkedUUIDs

      public void updateLinkedUUIDs()

    • getStartUUID

      public java.util.Optional<java.util.UUID> getStartUUID()
      Obtains the UUID of the start passage. Will not forcibly create a start passage.
      Returns:
      an Optional holding the UUID of the start passage (if it exists)

    • updateStartPassage

      public boolean updateStartPassage​(java.lang.String newStartPassage) throws InvalidPassageNameException
      Attempts to update the 'startPassage' field of the metadata, along with the startUUID field of this object, and also renaming the existing start passage if needed
      Specified by:
      updateStartPassage in interface EditWindowGameDataInterface
      Parameters:
      newStartPassage - the name of the new intended start passage
      Returns:
      true if the start passage was updated successfully
      Throws:
      InvalidPassageNameException - if the new start passage isn't valid

    • checkForStartRename

      public void checkForStartRename()
      Checks to see if the start passage was renamed, and, if so, it'll rename the reference to it in the metadata appropriately. And if there is no start passage, it'll forcibly create one.
      Specified by:
      checkForStartRename in interface EditWindowGameDataInterface

    • getStartUUID

      public java.util.Optional<java.util.UUID> getStartUUID​(boolean forceCreateStart)
      Obtains the UUID of the start passage
      Parameters:
      forceCreateStart - if this is true, if the start passage doesn't exist yet, it will forcibly create the start passage.
      Returns:
      an Optional holding the UUID of the start passage (if it exists)

    • thisPassageHasBeenDeleted

      public void thisPassageHasBeenDeleted​(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Informs this object that the passage with the specified UUID has been deleted. If aforementioned passage was the start passage, this object should set the start passage UUID to be that of another arbitrary passage which still exists.
      Specified by:
      thisPassageHasBeenDeleted in interface EditWindowGameDataInterface
      Parameters:
      uuid - UUID of deleted passage.

    • getPassageMap

      public java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> getPassageMap()
      Gets passage map.
      Specified by:
      getPassageMap in interface EditWindowGameDataInterface
      Returns:
      the passage map

    • getTheMetadata

      public MetadataEditingInterface getTheMetadata()
      Gets the metadata.
      Specified by:
      getTheMetadata in interface EditWindowGameDataInterface
      Returns:
      the the metadata

    • getSavePath

      public java.nio.file.Path getSavePath()
      Gets the path to where this object is saved
      Returns:
      savePath

    • openPassageEditWindow

      public EditorWindowInterface openPassageEditWindow​(java.util.UUID passage)
      Creates a PassageEditorWindow for the given passage (and the entire gamedata)
      Parameters:
      passage - the UUID of the passage in question which is having its PassageEditorWindow opened
      Returns:
      a PassageEditorWindow which allows a user to edit the passage in question

    • openMetadataEditWindow

      public EditorWindowInterface openMetadataEditWindow()
      Creates a MetadataEditorWindow for this game
      Returns:
      the MetadataEditorWindow allowing the user to edit the metadata

    • addClosedListener

      private EditorWindowInterface addClosedListener​(EditorWindowInterface w)
      Adds some window closed listeners (for cleanup and such) to the given EditorWindowInterface object
      Parameters:
      w - the EditorWindowInterface that the listeners are being added to
      Returns:
      the EditorWindowInterface but with the listeners added to it

    • getPassageEditingInterfaceObjectsConnectedToGivenObject

      public java.util.Set<PassageEditingInterface> getPassageEditingInterfaceObjectsConnectedToGivenObject​(java.util.UUID uuidOfSourceObject)
      Obtains the PassageEditingInterface objects of all the passages which the given passage links to
      Parameters:
      uuidOfSourceObject - the UUID of the passage that we're trying to find the 'child' passages of
      Returns:
      the UUIDs of all the 'child' passages

    • getThePassageObjectsWhichLinkToGivenPassageFromUUID

      public java.util.Set<java.util.UUID> getThePassageObjectsWhichLinkToGivenPassageFromUUID​(java.util.UUID destination)
      Obtains the UUIDs of the passages that link to the destination passage
      Parameters:
      destination - the UUID of the passage that we're trying to find the 'parent' passages of
      Returns:
      the UUIDs of all the 'parent' passage

    • saveTheHecc

      public void saveTheHecc() throws java.io.IOException
      Saves the .hecc
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • toHecc

      public java.lang.String toHecc()
      Get the .hecc version of the data held in this object
      Specified by:
      toHecc in interface Heccable
      Returns:
      The data held within theMetadata and in passageMap but in .hecc form

    • quickAndDirtyHecc

      private java.lang.String quickAndDirtyHecc()
      Returns the entire GameDataObject in .hecc form using streams. But the passages aren't in any particular order.
      Returns:
      a string containing all the .hecc code.

    • breadthFirstHeccBuilder

      private java.lang.String breadthFirstHeccBuilder()
      An iterative method for building the .hecc code for the passages, (breadth first)
      Returns:
      a string containing all the .hecc code for the passages

    • startDepthFirstHeccBuilder

      private java.lang.String startDepthFirstHeccBuilder()
      A method which starts to build the .hecc file recursively (depth first, prefix traversal)
      Returns:
      a string containing all the .hecc code for the passages

    • depthFirstHeccBuilder

      private java.lang.String depthFirstHeccBuilder​(java.util.Set<java.util.UUID> allKeys, java.util.UUID current)
      Only call this via startDepthFirstHeccBuilder. This actually does the recursion and the depth first (prefix traversal) stuff
      Parameters:
      allKeys - set of all the keys which haven't been found yet
      current - UUID of the current key being looked at
      Returns:
      a string containing the .hecc code for the current passage and all its children, constructed depth-first.
